featured.title: Entertainment Guide 2018: Philadelphia, Curated
featured.author: Web Dev: Alex Graves, Jess Peng, Daniel Salib
featured.description: For our Philadelphia, Curated issue, we spotlighted our favorite Philadelphia haunts that we wanted to share with our readers. From music venues and art galleries to comedy clubs and playhouses, we wanted to show you the best of what the city has to offer.

featured.title: Penn 10: Penn’s younger, cooler, 30 under 30
featured.author: Web Dev: Daniel Salib
featured.description: Penn 10 is a collection of student profiles spotlighting members of the senior class that have done incredible work during their time here.

featured.title: Dining Guide Spring 2018
featured.author: Web Dev: Jamie Tomlinson, Daniel Salib
featured.description: Your favorite issue is back with a mouthwatering vengeance! Inside you'll find your new favorite off–campus happy hour, tips on how to meal prep, and more. But don't read when hungry. You've been warned.

articles.title: Love Issue 2018
articles.author: Web Dev: Jamie Tomlinson, Alex Graves
articles.description: For Valentine's Day this year, we wanted to collect stories that gestured at the reality of love as we feel it: messy, sticky, weird, and something we can't claim to fully understand.

articles.title: End the Silence: Sexual Assault Survivors at Penn Share Their Stories
articles.author: Web Dev: Brady Africk, Andrew Fischer, Alex Graves
articles.description: Content warning: sexual assault and violence | Sexual assault survivors at Penn share their stories.

articles.title: Dining Guide Fall 2017
articles.author: Web Dev: Jess Peng, Andrew Fischer
articles.description: Step outside the Penn bubble and see what one of America's greatest food cities has to offer.

articles.title: Penn10: Ten of Penn's Most Impressive Seniors
articles.author: Web Dev: Andrew Fischer
articles.description: Read about ten of Penn's extraordinary seniors, brought to you by 34th Street and made possible by Penn Alumni.

articles.title: The Dividing Line
articles.author: Web Dev: Dhruv Agarwal, Joseph Gao, Luke Chen
articles.description: Students' perceptions of cocaine perpetuate a split dichotomy.
